text: when we're right on the edge of the
police corn that's been thrown around
the crash site this is as close as we
can get about five kilometres away and
all morning we've been seeing and
the area it's just beyond that Brown
Ridge there beyond the tree line in a
valley deep below where the wreckage of
flight 9525 lay strewn across an area
we're about of a hundred to two hundred
meters and from this position here you
get a real sense of just how secluded
how remote the area is and how difficult
it's going to be for the rescue services
to get to the wreckage and recover some
of the bodies of those who died
apparently it's a good three hour hike
by foot to get anywhere near that site
